name: The Ricky Gervais Guide to: Comic Relief

transcript.content: St. Francis of Assisi once said: "Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance." Acts of human charity have been documented since the beginning of recorded history. Yet even now, in the most democratic and economically advanced nations, charity is still necessary. Does this mean that charitable acts are failing to affect meaningful change? Should charity even be the responsibility of individual citizens, or is it the obligation of government? Do handouts make people lazy, independent, instead of resourceful and responsible for their own livelihoods? Is it every man for himself, or are we all in this together? To discuss these questions and more, I'm joined by Stephen Merchant, award winning writer and graduate of the University of Warwick.
Hello.
And Karl Pilkington.
Ricky pauses and sighs
Gonk.
Alright.
Intro music
So Red Nose day, Comic Relief has come round again.
Yeah. Red Nose Day is obviously the very specific date in the calendar for the whole generic term, comic relief, I think.

It's normally when the telecast happens, people know that that's the day when they can dress up, do charitable acts. But of course, Comic Relief is a charity that's working all the time for disenfranchised all over the world.
And you can go to the website all year round, which is ComicRelief dot com.
I think there's also RedNoseDay dot com, which is if you particularly want to donate for this year's appeal. Have you always been a strong champion of comic relief, Karl?
Not really.
Steve and Ricky laugh silently
Why was I expecting that answer?
But we're doing a bit of charity now. We're donating our time. It's not much, it's not costing anything.
But I do loads of stuff without going on about it. I don't think you should shout about how much you did for charity, because then who you're doing it for.

Oh, exactly. I mean, well, this is my thing, isn't it? That there's a lot of people that only do it if it's in the public eye. It's to do it really to be a busy body or to show off or to feel good about themselves. And I suppose that's good and bad. I mean, if it gets you involved, if it does some good.
My gift to the world has been you, Karl. To be quite honest. I feel that you're the world's now.
I'm sure there's people in Africa going 'We'd prefer blankets!"
Ricky laughs
Yeah
Doing a will is charity, isn't it?
Is it?
Sort of.
No, it is.
I mean, if you make a donation to a charity within the will, I suppose that's quite charitable. But just giving money to your relatives isn't, is it?
Of course it is. Well, they shouldn't have it.
They're getting somewhat for nothing, but... I don't know. It's giving something away that you have no use for.
Exactly!
Yeah, but forget that. It's "someone is getting something when they've done nothing for it" really.

Well, I suppose it is charity, but charity is usually infused with some sort of altruism. It's usually to do with them giving a piece of something that is kindly because you could do with it. Not strictly. I think you can give away something you don't need. But it's hardly donating a kidney, is it? Or some of your wages. It's like, it's not charity on your part because you're literally not around anymore. So it's no longer you giving it.
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
Sure.
So it's just a vase with shit in it, it doesn't work. And this is what we need to do, we need to get out there and say, "This is how it works." Educate them.
Okay, so let's do this, then, so it's with the seeds. You're not giving them - So I'm a starving African. "Hello, Karl, have you got any food? Got any food? Got any sandwiches?"
"Well, I have, but if I give you my sandwich, there's someone else behind you, they'll all come out."
"So what are you going to do then? What are you going to do?"
"I'm going to help you."
How? What are you going to do?
I'm going to make you think about how to make food.
"Okay, right."
"Have you ever grown anything before?"
"No."
"Right, well, there's some seeds."
"Oh, thanks, Karl. See you later. Do I just put them in the ground?"
"Yeah, put them in the ground. Water them."
"Oh, there's no water. You dopey cunt."
There is some.
"No, there's no water, you dopey cunt. That's why we're starving, you dopey cunt."
Right. Well, at that point, that's where I go. "Well, this is a lost cause here, cause there's no point.
"So then, can I have your sandwich after all or what?"
No, you're not having it.
So not only can I not have a sandwich, you give me seeds with no water, you useless, bald headed fucking twonk.
Right, but all I've done there is made the mistake of the computer firm who's given a laptop to a tribe. It's useless. Right, but there's got to be another way around this.
Go on, then.
Either move, because every year they're going to be queuing up saying, "I'm hungry, give me a sandwich." - "No, you're not having another sandwich."
Once again, it's an utterly ill-informed discussion.

I'm just saying there's no point queuing up every year, "You want a sandwich, here's a sandwich. The next year, "Can I have a sandwich? "Where's your brother?" - "He died." It's not sorting anything. It's buying him an extra day, an extra month or something. It's pointless.
But Karl, the point is, like, Ricky's just flagged up, is that some of these countries, the conditions.
"He died", "He died"
- the conditions are not there to just be able to plant potato seeds.
So, what are they meant to do then? Do you think we should go out every, every month, every year with sandwiches? Is that your answer? Like some sort of buffet? An all you can eat thing once a year?
Oh, God,
See, It is bad.
I don't want to come across harsh. We, they've got nothing, we waste stuff here. Waste annoys me just as much.
Right
When I see sandwich shops chucking stuff out -
Yeah
- in bin bags, binning it. When there's people out there who are hungry. It's ridiculous. I don't understand. It's a problem that isn't being solved.
So your conclusion, for these people, because there's no water where they are, right, is move. That is your honest, they should move?
Well, what's your solution?
Well, I don't know. I don't know the ins and outs. I don't even pretend to know.
But I'll tell you, it's not just, it's sticking a - what's that saying? I don't know. Sort of sticking a plaster over a hole or something, and the plaster comes off its a problem again.
Yeah, that's the saying. I think that was Mark Twain. Um, No.
Sounds more like Ghandi. If you would like to donate to comic relief, why not visit rednoseday.com?
Oh, I've got to tell you something, Steve, that cropped up when we were at dinner the other night. Karl said the most exciting words. He said, "I've had another film idea."
Wow. Does it star Clive Warren?
No, it doesn't. He's gone bigger than that.
Wow
Karl, tell 'em the film idea.
Yeah, but you slagged it off an' that.
No, I was just trying to, we were all chipping in, saying that, well, they're all trying to help.

No, Suzanne - you see, you had a go and then Suzanne thought, "Oh, I'm going to have a go here as well." If I'd have told her that home, she'd just go, "Yeah...." That'd be that. But suddenly Jane was chipping in, everybody was having a go. Yet I didn't see anyone else coming up with anything.
Well, they didn't realize it was a script editing meeting.
Yeah, they just thought it was a dinner.
They're just saying, "Oh, that, you know."
No, I'll tell you why it cropped up - I saw it - it was another thing in that free paper.
Yep
It was something about the way we're advancing fast.
Right.
Which reminded me of the, you know, me film, "The Love of Two Brains" and stuff.
How's that going, is that being made yet?
And it was just saying, you know, about um... how bodies can get reused, in a way, recycling, is the ultimate...
What did it say about that, though? Because you didn't go into that.
It was hinting at bodies being reused.
When you say hinting - you saw a bit of a headline and didn't read on?
No.
What? Made the rest up in your head?
No, it was scientists saying, in the future, it's that old thing. In the future, this is what we'll be able to do.
Do you mean like Frankenstein being reused, old body parts, fusing together?
Yeah, but that was all different, it was like a short arm and a long leg and that, this is a full body.
Right. So, pitch the film idea to me. Sell it to me like I'm a Hollywood executive. Sell me the film.
Right. Well, I'd probably tell you about the science facts there that I've read.

Okay, let's start from scratch then. "Oh, thank you so much, Karl, for coming in. We heard there was a rumor that you're dealing with another British film company about a thing with a man with two brains, with a guy called Clive Warren we haven't heard of, but Rebecca De Mornay we're very excited about because she wouldn't be a lot to get, so this film wouldn't cost much.

Right. So, like I say, I've read - they're going to be sort of the ultimate in recycling. If anything happens to the brain, they can reuse the body. Remember, that by the time this film is made, that's probably going to be bigger news.
Fantastic.
So it'd be great if it can coincide with that.
We love this sort of research. We love this level of research. It's exciting.
So what I was thinking is, um, I'm picturing, probably it doesn't matter. It's not as fixed. It doesn't have to be this person, but I'm thinking Tom Cruise.
Okay. Cruzy. Yeah.
Excellent.
Excellent.
Um, and the way it works is -
Do you know Tom, by the way, or have you got an in there?
No.
Okay.
I think it's the sort of film
That would appeal to Tom.
That he'd sort of be into. I think it would excite him.
Okay.
Okay. Great.
Have we ordered coffees?
What?
Did Cheryl get you a coffee?
Yeah.
Okay, thanks.
Great.
Are you hungry at all? Do you want to?
No.
Great.
Cheryl?
I might have a tea, actually, Cheryl, if you could.
We'll wait for the teas before she comes in?
She'll just sneak in. She will be very quiet. She'll be like a door mouse. She won't even notice she's come in. You've got your coffee. I'm getting tea. You don't want anything?
No
Go.
Actually, I will have a tea. Actually, Cheryl.
Two teas, Cheryl. Thanks
Okay, go.
Right.
Thanks, Cheryl.
Sorry, is there sugar in this Cheryl?
Shut the door behind you. Thank you. Okay. Go all the way. Go.
Tom Cruise. I got Tom Cruise. That's what I've pictured so far.
He's just done Mission Impossible 7.
Right.
In this film.
Oh, in the film.
So he's playing himself?
No, what you're seeing on the screen is Mission Impossible 7. Like I say, if we don't get cruise, it can be Bourne Identity, and it can be what's it.
Oh, so if we get Cruise, he is playing himself.
Yeah.
And he's just made...
And in this film, he's just made Mission Impossible 7. It's the future. Is it this?
Now what you're seeing, right, is Mission Impossible 7 on the screen.
So I've gone into the cinema and I think I'm going in to see Mission Impossible 7? Or I'm going in knowing that it's this film.
Yeah.
I'm going in to see...
Okay, what's this film called?
I haven't got a title yet.
We'll just call it Karl Pilkington project two.
Right.
Okay
So you go in. The opening thing is Mission Impossible 7. You think I've seen this.
I thought it was KP two.
Yeah.
Confused?
Yeah.
Excuse me. Excuse me. I came in to see KP two. This is not the film I came to see. I'm talking to the usher. I'm talking to the usher.
No, this is the film. What you're seeing is Mission Impossible 7.
I don't understand.
Right, listen. So what happens is then it sort of pans out, you see, it's a telly.
Ahh.
Ahh.
There's a bloke watching Mission Impossible 7. Right. His girlfriend's watching it, going, I love Tom Cruise.
Yeah.
He's there going, I can't be doing with him.
So it is set in the future, though this because we're assuming that he's made seven. So this is a...
Yeah.
How far in the future is it?
Well, when will Mission Impossible 7 be made?
I don't know. Probably about two years, the way it's going.
Right. So, yeah, 2013.
Okay.
And this is underway then, is it? This a practice of recycling the body?
Yeah. By then it's well known that it's out there as scientific...
Let's not get bogged down in a lot of these things we can iron out, as I say in the script.
So you see Mission Impossible 7 on the screen.
Cheryl, are any of those biscuits still knocking around?
Do you want to do this meeting?!

Yes, I do. Sorry, he's a bit easily distracted. But I will have a biscuit as well Cheryl. Okay. I've been watching this film. It's Mission Impossible 7. It's pulled out. There's a guy in his room in his lounge.
His girlfriend's watching it. She's loving it. She's a fan of Tom Cruise.
She's love Tom Cruise. Right.
He's a little bit niggled. He wanted to watch something else.
Sure.

She decided on the DVD. He sat there annoyed. I can't be doing with Tom Cruise. I can't believe they've made seven of these films. He's a rubbish actor. I should be the actor. I've been doing acting for years.
But he's not an actor?
Well, he is.
Okay.
But he hasn't quite made it. He's in Pantos. He's sending a lot of demos off, but he's just not been seen.
It's funny because I remember this is one of our notes. To make it more plausible, this film. Because you didn't have him as an actor before, did you?
Yeah, well, this is how it works, isn't it?
Right. Interesting.
Yeah. Well, you two don't know about that meeting, do you?
Right, so he's a struggling actor.
So what happens is, next day they get up, right?
Yep.
She's still going on about Tom Cruise.
Loves him.
He thinks I'm sick of him. She loves him.
Dropped my biscuits, gone in my tea. I left it in there too long.
Because he put me off, the stupid bald twat.
Just hang on, let me just think.
Can I get the spoon please. Oh it's all gone soggy.
Cheryl, Can we get some more of those biscuits in here, please?
Karl sounds annoyed
Do you want to hear more or?!
Yeah, I'd love to hear more please yeah.
Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah.
I'm just conscious that Colin Firth's coming in. He's won an Oscar.
He's got an idea about a prince with a cleft palette.
Anyway, listen, so what happens is he gets so annoyed with his girlfriend liking Tom Cruise, he plans to kill him.
So he plans to kill Tom Cruise?!
Wow this is new. I've never heard this before.
Now this man is a struggling actor. He's obviously based in the UK because he's in panto. So he flies to Hollywood.
No, the equivalent of that.
Oh, he's based in the?
He's a bit part player.
Yeah.
So he sees Tom Cruise, he kills him somehow. Now in some way...
Right. How does he kill him? Because this is all new to me.
I don't want to put everything down on paper. This is just a rough, ideal pitch.
Because again in the original pitch in the restaurant, Tom Cruise just dies on the set of Mission Impossible 7.
Steve laughs
Oh I see. Right.
Oh yeah, yeah, yeah. That's right.
Oh hang on.
So he dies in the film in Mission Impossible 7. They're doing that thing on the strings. He cuts, he lands.
Right.
His body is in perfect condition.
So hold on....
But how is she watching the film?
Yeah. Did they put it out even after Tom Cruise died?
No, sorry. He was filming Mission Impossible 8.
Okay.
He's filming the next one.
They're filming the next one. Mission Impossible 8. Okay, sure.
He's annoyed, he's going, I can't believe they're making more of these films. I can't get a gig. And yet they're churning this crap out.
Yeah, okay.
So he's on his springs.
On his wires. Yeah.
On his wires. An accident happens...
Steve starts to laugh
Springs sounds better.
He's bouncing around.
Like a baby grow.
The strings cut. Smash. Tom Cruise dead alright.
Right.
Right.

The bloke hears this on the radio, on the news. The girlfriend's fella, hears it on the news. He can't believe it. He's like, yeah, takes his eye off the road a little bit in the celebration. Dooof truck, plows into the car.
So he's killed as well.
Well, is he?
Okay?

Little interlude fades up, comes out of. You're seeing it out of his eyes. You see his eyes sort of opening. Do you know when you're seeing out the eyes, you see the eyelids and you see his girlfriend there sort of looking at him like a bit startled.
Sure.
And he's going, oh, what happened? And she's going, it's all right, it's all right. And he's going, oh, get me a mirror. She's going, I don't want to get you a mirror yet.
Okay.
Oooo hold on, what's going on?
You've had a bad accident.
Probably terribly disfigured is he?
This is what he's thinking, oh, how bad do you know?
Scarred. Burned.
You fancy that Tom Cruise. I've gone the other way. She's going, it's all right, it's all right.
It can't be relevant, though, that Tom Cruise was killed at the same time. I don't need to think about Tom Cruise. I'll put him out of my mind. Put him out of my mind.
Anyway.
What's he gonna to look?

All mirrors are out of the room and everything. He's just learning to learn to walk. He's going, why can't I look in a mirror? And the doctor's going, no point, no point. You've got to get used to this body. What do you mean?
It's great that Tom Cruise just did a small cameo at the beginning of this film.
This is good as well because we're seeing it through the... What's the voice like, by the way?
The bloke's voice.
It's the same.
Just the same as it was earlier. So the whole thing is through his eyes. I haven't seen his face.
No.
Then he gets walking. It's almost time to go home. His girlfriend comes in. It's her job to tell him the new news.
Oh my god, what is the news?
So there's a mirror, look in there. He looks in it. He's Tom Cruise.
Ricky and Steve simultaneously
Right.
Right.
Because he had his accident on the set. He had the accident, they ended up in the hospital. Quick, quick. We've got to act quick. This is the time, this is the future where they use...
Where they can use bodies.
Bodies, all the rest of it.
So tom Cruise is dead.
Tom Cruise dead. This bloke Brian..
His body's squashed. But what's his name? Brian.
Yeah
But Brian's brain is in Tom Cruise. Just a donor body. He just happens to.
Just happen to. That's how it be.
It's just meat.
Just like a lung donor or a heart donor
Exactly. Yeah.
Brian, he just looks like Tom Cruise now. He's got Tom Cruise's flesh, basically. Yeah.
Now, at first, initially, he's annoyed because he like going, I hate Tom Cruise!
But his voice is still the same as his was, even though it's got Tom Cruise's mouth.
He's got a bit of both.
A little bit different.
But. Okay, sorry, just practically. Who is doing the voiceover then, for the...
It's Tom now.
So Tom's sort of doing an impression of this actor.
Brian's inside Tom.
His name is Brian. But when you look at it on the telly, when the camera woozes round and you see him sat in his bed, it's Tom Cruise.
Sure.
Right, okay.
His girlfriend's over the moon because she loves Tom Cruise.
Right.
He's gutted because he couldn't stand him. He can't stand the films. He's thinking...
Yeah, but he must be thinking, I look like Tom Cruise, one of the most loved actors of his generation.
You'd think so but he's not, because he's in shock remember? He was expecting to see himself. When he looks in the mirror, he's seeing someone else.
Must be shocking yeah.
So he's going, I can't stand this. And she's going, calm down, calm down. You'll get used to it. I don't want to get used to it. And she's sort of saying, look, you're alive.
Right.
Stop moaning.
Stop moaning, Brian. She's calling him Brian I assume?
She says...
And Tom Cruise just had a sort of donor card that allowed his body to be given away
Did it?
Yeah.
It's the future.
Right.
This is 2013, Steve. Things have changed.
Steve laughs
Clearly.
Right, what's his girlfriend's name?
Claire.
Claire and Brian. Okay, great. Just a different body, just a slightly different look.
All right, so he's seen that he looks like Tom Cruise. He's shocked, but he's getting used to it?
He doesn't look like him. He is him.
Okay.
No, he's not him. He's Brian, isn't he?
Yeah, but to most people, when he leaves the hospital...
They go alright Tom? I thought you were dead?
They're all going, It's Tom. It's Tom.
Really?
Yeah. Yeah. And he's going, oh, I knew this would happen. It's doing me head in.
And the paparazzi? Do they think it's Tom.
No, no.
Let him explain.
Sorry Rick because you've heard this. I want to hear this story.
This is weird, though, because he looks like Tom Cruise.

So he wheels out. He's in a wheelchair. He's going, I'm sick of this. The other patients are going, Tom, I thought you were dead. And he's going, yeah, and he's annoyed. He gets in the car, he gets out there and he sees a poster up on the side of the road for Mission Impossible 8.
... Hold on though. It's finished? I thought he died while they were filming it.
It's not finished. But now these days they're shouting about films before they're made.
Steve laughs
Yeah you're right!
Like Lord of the Rings, isn't it? Yeah, they're going, Lord of the Rings is in the making and they're going, brilliant. And all the hype and everything.
And they put the poster up? Even after...
Premature.
No, the poster was already up.
Really?!
That seems premature given that a man died during the production.
Doesn't matter!
I'd have taken the posters down, but then I don't work in Hollywood.
Right.
So the poster's up there and he sees it as he's in the car driving past and he thinks, that can't be finished.
Doesn't makes sense. Yeah.
They both look at each other. This is your chance. You wanted to be an actor. This is the chance.
Yeah.
Right.
Go back to the studio. So he goes in. Hello, you don't know me. And they go, oh, we think we do. They go, no, you don't. I'm Brian. Tom died on your film set.
Well, they must know that. They must know that..
Steve and Ricky at the same time
...Tom Cruise died.
...Tom Cruise is dead. Because his family must have been notified.
Alright if you want. It makes no difference. We can tweak the script.
Steve laughs
You have because before he was a plumber, by the way.
Steve laughs more
It was a plumber who was turning up going, I'm going to finish Mission Impossible 8.
I'd much prefer that!
Ricky laughs
And I could sort out your lavatory.
You get the idea.

No, we don't get the idea. So this is. Brian has turned up looking like Tom Cruise. He said, the film company, right. Who must know that Tom Cruise died on their film set. What were they going to do when..?
They were gonna have to wrap it up. They'd have had to say...
But you said they put the posters are up!
Yes, the posters are up before they've even finished filming it.
So they're canceling the film until he walks in?
Basically, yeah.
So they ARE canceling the film.
They're canceling it.
Okay. So we are afraid that production has stopped on Mission Impossible 8 due to the death of Tom Cruise.
Hang on a minute.
What?
I'm Brian.
Who's Brian? Oh, my God, you look exactly like Tom Cruise. Oh, have they done that thing where they put Brian's brain in Tom Cruise's body?
Yep.
But he's not Tom Cruise. You can't act like him.
I'm an actor.
Yeah but are you as good? Because he was like one of the best actors.
He's not that good. I never rated him.
Yeah, but a lot of people did.
Yeah, a lot of people didn't. So let me bring in a new audience for you here. I can bring a bit to this.
Right.
So the film people. So just tell me what happens. Do they sign up the new guy? They sign up Brian?
It must be in the news? It must be in the news. It must be in the news that Tom Cruise died.
Are they pretending that it's really Tom? Tom survived?
No, no. They can't do that.
They can't do that.
No.
But they're quite unscrupulous these Hollywood people.
So they've told the world that Brian is taking over. Brian. Right. He used to be a plumber, but he's now...
Steve begins laughing
This is Brian who has no surname.
Just Brian.
He's like Madonna or Cher.
Exactly. Brian. Right. Is that Brian?
It's above the title. Brian in.
I bet it's Bryan with a y.
Bryan with a y in Mission Impossible 8.
This won't work. Where Tom Cruise? It's not the same.
So this, of course, gives it a boost because...
Right... People want to see how good Bryan is.
The flagging franchise is being rejuvenated.
The press, the news that's out there, Tom Cruise in his new film.
Well, it's not Tom Cruise. They can't say that.
Well, it is, though. When you look at him, you go, oh, it's Tom Cruise.
Well, no, you got to say a bloke that looks like Tom Cruise.
The body of Tom Cruise....
Yeah.
The acting of.... Bryan.
Ricky and Steve laugh
In a new movie...
Mission impossible eight, starring the bones and skin and stuff of Tom Cruise with Brian's brain.
Oh, forget it.
Do you like Tom Cruise's face and not his acting?
Rick and Steve laugh
Then you'll enjoy Mission Impossible 8.
I can't be bothered.
Mission Impossible 8. From the people that brought you the first seven and the hair of the bloke who was in the first seven but with Bryan doing all the lines!
Rick and Steve in hysterics
It's some cunt I've never heard of! In the seventh sequel!
No wait. I really want to hear the ending of this movie. Please let me ask questions. You had your chance to ask him questions.
Right.
So where are we in a sort of 90 minutes running time of a movie? Where are we now in the film? Are we about two thirds the way through?
Close. We're close. The end.
We're close to the end?!
Okay, so Mission Impossible 8 has been made. So what's the end of our movie? Not of Mission Impossible 8, but the movie you're making. What's the ending there?
Do we ever get to see him in Mission Impossible 8?
Yeah, but I think what happens is he becomes the person who he never liked.
Right.

And I just want to get across the moral that, who are we? Are we the people in our body or the people we look like? What's important in life? Is it the way you look or the way you think and he changes because he looks like Tom Cruise. He becomes the man he never liked.

But you see, to me, just from the outsider's point of view, even if I was to accept all the other premise of this movie, which is clearly horseshit. What would have been more interesting is that they don't tell the world that it's a new guy. That they tell the world it's Tom and they've brought him back to life.
He'll have that.

That seems more interesting because then there's tension. They're lying to the world. And this guy, he's getting the glory that he always wanted as an actor, but he's lying. And that's a more interesting tension. Is he going to declare? Actually, I'm not really Tom, I'm Brian. I've been lying to you all, and that seems like a more interesting dilemma. Instead, we've brought back the walking corpse of Tom Cruise with another man's mind.
But I think people...
If the whole world's accepting of that.
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
